Package com.univpm.oop.WeatherPal.model.tools

Class MeasuresAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
com.univpm.oop.WeatherPal.model.tools.MeasuresAnalyzer
public class MeasuresAnalyzer extends Object
Class to find max, min, average, variance and standard deviation of a given vector of Measure (or suubclasses)

  • Method Details

    • findMax

      public static <T> Measure<? extends Comparable<T>> findMax(Vector<? extends Measure<? extends Comparable<T>>> array)
      Method to get the maximum element of a vector of Measure (or subclasses). The values of these measures must implement Comparable interface, because vector's elements are compared using Comparable's compareTo method.
      Type Parameters:
      T - T : class that implements Comparable interface
      Parameters:
      array - : vector of Measure (or subclasses) with values that implements Comparable interface
      Returns:
      the maximum element of array

    • findMin

      public static <T> Measure<? extends Comparable<T>> findMin(Vector<? extends Measure<? extends Comparable<T>>> array)
      Method to get the minimum element of a vector of Measure (or subclasses). The values of these measures must implement Comparable interface, because vector's elements are compared using Comparable's compareTo method.
      Type Parameters:
      T - T : class that implements Comparable interface
      Parameters:
      array - : vector of Measure (or subclasses) with values that implements Comparable interface
      Returns:
      the minumum element of array

    • distribAvg

      public static HashMap<String,Object> distribAvg(Vector<? extends Measure<? extends Distribution>> array)
      Method that creates an average representation of all the objects in the 'value' field of array's measures and returns it as an hashmap. This hashmap has the same tree node structure of the class of the values of array's measures: each key is the name of an attribute of that class, the corresponding value is the average of that attribute's values in the measures of array.

      The difference with an object of that class is that the hasmap has all double values, even those who were integers. Not numerical fields of the reference class (e.g. strings) are not present in the hashmap.

      Parameters:
      array - : a vector of Measures (or subclasses). The 'value' field of those measures must be a class that implements Distribution interface
      Returns:
      a hashmap that represents the average of the values of all the measures contained in array.

    • distribVar

      public static HashMap<String,Object> distribVar(Vector<? extends Measure<? extends Distribution>> array)
      Method that creates a ''varince representation'' of all the objects in the 'value' field of array's measures nd returns it as an hashmap. This hashmap has the same tree node structure of the class of the values of array's measures: each key is the name of an attribute of that class, the corresponding value is the variance of that attribute's values in the measures of array.

      The difference with an object of that class is that the hasmap has all double values, even those who were integers. Not numerical fields of the reference class (e.g. strings) are not present in the hashmap.

      Parameters:
      array - : a vector of Measures (or subclasses). The 'value' field of those measures must be a class that implements Distribution interface
      Returns:
      a hashmap that represents the variance of the values of all the measures contained in array.

    • distribStdDev

      public static HashMap<String,Object> distribStdDev(Vector<? extends Measure<? extends Distribution>> array)
      Method that creates a ''standard deviation representation'' of all the objects in the 'value' field of array's measures and returns it as an hashmap. This hashmap has the same tree node structure of the class of the values of array's measures: each key is the name of an attribute of that class, the corresponding value is the standard deviation of that attribute's values in the measures of array.

      The difference with an object of that class is that the hasmap has all double values, even those who were integers. Not numerical fields of the reference class (e.g. strings) are not present in the hashmap.

      Parameters:
      array - : a vector of Measures (or subclasses). The 'value' field of those measures must be a class that implements Distribution interface
      Returns:
      a hashmap that represents the standard deviation of the values of all the measures contained in array.
